io.sarl.core

Class SRE

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sarl.core.SRE

  • public final class SRE
extends Object
    Represents an access point to the SARL run-time environment (SRE). This access point may be used for accessing the underlying SRE independently of its implementation.

    Depending on the implementation of the SRE, an instance of this SRE access point could be injected.

    For declaring a SRE bootstrap, the library that contains the contributing SRE must declared a specific service implementation of SREBootstrap. The declaration of this service must be done by creating a file into the folder META-INF/services/io.sarl.lang.core.SREBootstrap. This file contains a single line that is the fully qualified name of the SREBootstrap's implementation.

    Since:
    0.6
    Version:

    Author:

      • getServiceLoader

        @Pure
public static def getServiceLoader([onlyInstalledInJRE : boolean]) : ServiceLoader<SREBootstrap> 
        Description copied from class: SRE
        Replies all the installed SRE into the classpath.
        Parameters:
        onlyInstalledInJRE - indicates if the services will be considered only into the libraries that are installed into the JRE. If true, only the libraries into the JRE will be considered and the application libraries will be ignored. If false, the application libraries will be considered as well.
        Returns:
        the installed SRE.

      • getBootstrap

        @Pure
public static def getBootstrap() : SREBootstrap 
        Description copied from class: SRE
        Find and reply the current SRE.
        Returns:
        the current SRE, never null.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a SRE cannot be found.
